header.title: Students dress in blackface and KKK hoods for ‘non-PC party’
header.postText: A group of Australian university students who dressed up as the Ku Klux Klan and a ‘cotton picking’ slave for a ‘politically incorrect’ themed party are facing an investigation.', 'The men, from Charles Sturt University attended an end-of-semester party at the Black Swan Hotel.', 'Five of them were dressed up as members of the Ku Klux Klan, while one of the party was in blackface, carrying a bowl of cotton.', 'One of the photos, which have since been deleted, was captioned: ‘Very very politically incorrect. Cotton prices are unreal though so it’s a great time to be picking.’', 'A group on social media was created to invite people to the two-day event.', 'It said: ‘As exams have just commenced we are already looking forward to the end of term and thus, the idea of the muddy duck “two dayer” has been born.', '‘Thursday night [is a] ‘politically incorrect’ themed session kicking off at 7.30pm. So grab a kit that would legally get you in the shit and hook right in.’', 'The students were slammed as racist after the photo was shared, with angry social media users sharing the students’ personal information, reports MailOnline.', 'The student who posted the photo had his date of birth, address, driver’s licence number, workplace, rugby club and university posted on Twitter.', '‘[He]thinks it’s ok to be a racist prick… Feel free to contact his Employer, Uni and Club,’ wrote the person who shared the information.', '‘Disgusting – how can anyone think this is okay?’ asked another person.', 'In a now-deleted Facebook post, the Black Swan Hotel said it had no prior knowledge of the racist costumes.', '‘The pub was made aware of an incident unbeknownst to staff,’ it said.', '‘We were unaware of this behaviour happening out the back of the pub, however we have immediately dealt with this. We have zero tolerance and do not condone this behaviour.’
